about.title: About me
about.content1: I am a professional Social Worker who has been working for over 20 years, and I am as passionate about this profession, as I was when I started in this field.
about.content2: My clinical approach is client centered, offered in a laid back, nonjudgmental and relaxed atmosphere.  I will provide you with a warm support, professional and rigorous services.  My clinical years of experience enables me to accompany and focus on my clients’ needs with active listening and respect. My objective is to provide you with concrete tools that are readily accessible.
about.content3: Over the years of my practice, I have developed a broad range of expertise related to adoption, attachment, family dynamics and relationships.

approach.title: Approach
approach.subtitle: A modern and efficient approach.
approach.content1: I use a systemic approach, that is to say that I work with the individual in the context of their larger environment. This intervention model allows clients to better understand their present functioning within the context of interactions with others and their environment.
approach.content2: This approach supports clients’ self-determination which means that each client has the ability to decide what is best for him/herself. As such, a common language and understanding of the issue will be defined and new ways of thinking and identifying new strategies will be established.  The ultimate goal is for clients to feel a greater sense of personal and family empowerment in their day to day lives.

career.title: Career
career.universityContent: As a graduate in Social Services from Sherbrooke University in 1994, I developed the core of my practice by working in the public health system. In order to keep my knowledge up-to-date, I regularly attend conferences, seminars and trainings. Furthermore, I keep up with the new developments in the domain of family intervention and adoption by reading on this subject.
career.psychosocialContent: For over 20 years, I have been working in the psychosocial field and dealing with issues affecting families, children, adolescents and young adults. I have acquired a vast experience in parental coaching, working specifically on parent-child dynamics and/or addressing developmental issues when they manifest in children.
career.adoptionContent: For the past 13 years, I have had the chance to work with adoptive families on a daily basis. The animation of pre-adoption workshops for parents and their extended family is part of my field of expertise.  I have also acquired a vast experience in post adoption counselling, which is so important to guide and accompany adoptive parents of children of all ages.
career.orderContent: I am a social worker member in good standing of the Professional Order of Social Workers and Conjugal and Family Therapists of Quebec; I adhere to their code of ethics.

consult.title: Why consult ?
consult.subtitle: Family Support
consult.content1: In today’s world raising children is difficult.  Over the course of our children’s developmental stages many parents may experience specific challenges related to:
consult.bullet1: Bedtime routine, nightmares or night terrors
consult.bullet4: Reactions to the arrival of a second child
consult.bullet9: Adolescence and its questioning of identity
consult.content2: Parents may also face challenges in fulfilling their parenting roles. For example:
consult.bullet12: Adaptation to the role of new parent
consult.bullet13: Feeling competent and effective as a parent
consult.bullet15: Develop a parenting structure that respects the child’s developmental stage
consult.bullet16: Need to feel better equipped to face their child's tantrums
consult.bullet18: Knowing how to deal with your own expectations as a parent
consult.bullet19: Learn how to address adoption related issues
consult.content3: Psychosocial counseling can help you to develop a new perspective and understanding on your parental and/or relationship difficulties therefore alleviating stress. This is in an efficient way to gain a more positive perspective and attain a state of well-being and balance, which may presently seem out of reach.
